column1: Cyangugu (formerly Shangugu) is a city and capital of the Rusizi District in Western Province
column2: Rwanda. The city lies at the southern end of Lake Kivu
column5: but separated from it by the Ruzizi River. Two bridges and a dam cross the river frontier.

column1: The settlement has two main areas: Cyangugu itself is the low-density district on the lake shore
column3: the higher density industrial and transport centre is further inland and to the north. Kamembe Airport serves the city with flights 11 times a week to Kigali.

column1: The city lies near Nyungwe Forest
column3: being one of the last remaining forest areas of Rwanda and home to chimpanzees and many other species of primate.
